title: FinTech 15.S08
text: For those wishing to explore FinTech:
How new technologies are disrupting the financial services industry
Business models, products, applications and customer user interface
AI, Deep learning, Blockchain Technology and Open API’s
Competitive Landscape of FinTech Startups & Big Tech vs. Big Finance

title: Intro Class: Readings
text: 'The economic forces driving fintech adoption across countries' Jon Frost, BIS Working Papers
'FinTech and market structure in financial services' Financial Stability Board
'The Future of Banking' FDIC Chair Jelena McWilliams

title: Intro Class: Study Questions
text: What are the major technological trends materially influencing the provision of financial services?

How is the competitive landscape shaping adoption of these new technologies around the globe? How are FinTech start-ups and Big Tech firms competing and cooperating with incumbents from big finance? How has Big Finance reacted?
What do you wish to achieve in this Fintech course?

title: Intro Class: Overview
text: Teaching Team, Schedule, Assignments & Office Hours

title: Financial World
text: - Investing, Market Making, Marketing, Risk Management & Underwriting
- Credit; Funding; Liquidity; Market (Basis, Price, Rate, Spread, Volatility)
- Accidents; Health; Life Events; Natural Disasters; Weather

title: FinTech
text: 'Technology-enabled innovation in financial services associated with new business models, applications, processes or products, all of which have a material effect ...'

title: Funding & Risk Management
text: Interest Rate Futures (1970s) & Interest Rate Swaps (1980s) >
Consumer Finance Companies & Warehouse Lines of Credit (1920s) >
Bankruptcy & Secured Lending Laws, Loan Servicing & Collection Agents (Days of old) >

title: FinTech - Finance's Fertile Ground
text: Digitalization of Money, Securities and Credit
Vast and Expanding Amounts of Customer Data
Rapid Expansion of Computational & Analytical Power
Reliance on Multiple Systems of Ledgers
Wide Public Acceptance of New Tech
Legacy Customer Interface and Processing Systems
Infrastructure Systems' Costs and Counterparty Risks
Economic Rents and Centralized Concentrated Risks

title: FinTech – Disruptive Potential
text: AI for Managing Risks & Targeting Products
Updated Customer User Interface and Robo Advice
'Internet of Value': Movement of Value & Micro Payments
Streamlined Accounting, Clearing, Compliance & Processing Systems
Some Revenue Models shift to Data in exchange for Free Services
Efficiencies & Tighter Margins in Financial Sector

title:
AI and Machine Learning
Deep Learning in One Slide
text: Most big questions of intelligence have not been answered nor properly formulated

title: AI and Machine Learning - Finance
text: Call Centers, Chatbots, Robo-Advising & Virtual Assistants
Credit (& Insurance) Allocation, Extension, Pricing & Scoring
Regulatory – Anti Money Laundering, Anti Manipulation

title: Open API & Open Banking
text: Open Application Program Interfaces (Open API) allow outside Developers access to and an ability to Integrate Permissioned Customer Data into Third Party Applications
Open Banking initiatives facilitate or mandate Open API for Non-banks to Share Permissioned Bank Customer Data
Policy Trade-offs of Promoting Competition & Innovation, Limiting Cybersecurity Risks, and Maintaining Privacy & Consumer Protections
EU Payment System Directive (PSD2), UK Open Banking Initiative, etc.
Plus Screen Scraping, Reverse Engineering & Robotic Process Automation

title: Blockchain Tech Potential Uses
text: Tokens for Exchanges, Gaming, Gambling, DeFi & File Sharing
Tokenized Fiat (Stable Value Coins), Securities & Assets
Central Bank Digital Currencies & Payment Initiatives
Medical Records, Property Records, Internet of Things, Voting ...

title: FinTech – The Actors
text: Big Finance: Like Fortresses w/ Moats, Towers & Sovereign Affiliations
Towers: 1) Payments, 2) Balance Sheets, 3) Data, 4) Corporate Structure

title: GLOBAL INVESTMENT / BY PRODUCT
text: FUNDING INTO CHALLENGER BANKS MORE THAN TRIPLED IN 2019, HELPING LIFT CURRENT ACCOUNTS TOTALS; INSURTECH INVESTMENTS JUMPED 54%, WHILE FUNDING TO LENDING AND PAYMENTS STARTUPS BOTH GREW MORE THAN 20%
Note: Investments value referred to only deals with amount reported by CB Insights and deals volumes referred to all deals

Disclaimer: There might be variations in historical numbers in new releases of the FinTech Watchtower as Accenture Research performs historical review of the previous data in every release which include, not limiting to, adding/removing deals from CB Insights database based on relevance
Source: 'Fintech Fundraising Grew Strongly in Most Major Markets in 2019, Accenture Analysis Finds', Accenture (2/20/20)

title: FinTech: Technologies
text: Class 2 (4/1): Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning

title: FinTech: Wrapping it All Together
text: Class 1 (3/30): Intro & Key Technological Trends Affecting Financial Services

title: Assignments
text: Recommended business and technology strategy within a particular sector
To CEO of B of A, Amazon, or Andreessen Horowitz
Teams required to be Formed and Sector Selected by 4/8
Each student individually addresses 1 of the following:
a) overall market analysis, b) technology trend analysis, c) traditional competitor analysis, & d) big tech & fintech disrupter competitive analysis

title: Professionalism & Academic Integrity
text: Success goes to those Prepared, Curious & Self Starters
Respect & Courtesy builds Reputations, Networks & Trust
Learning comes best to those who Listen as well as Talk
Understanding Strategy and Paying Attention to Details both Matter
Staying True to your Values is the best alternative
